content: I've been trying to capture more ocean views and beach scenes, especially during sunrise and sunset. I've been experimenting with different shutter speeds and aperture settings, and I'm really interested in capturing the perfect silhouette. Speaking of silhouettes, I've been trying to capture the perfect one during these times, especially when it comes to exposing for the sky and the foreground. Do you have any tips on how to capture the perfect silhouette when there are people or objects in the foreground, like surfers or beach structures?
